conversation_history.content: Can you please describe any symptoms or behaviors that have led you to feel this way?
Are you experiencing any difficulties with thinking, remembering things, or understanding instructions?
No I can't touch my head.
Can you explain more about why you feel you can't touch your head? Is there any pain or discomfort when you try?
No I can't feel my head.
Have you noticed any other sensations or difficulties in different parts of your body?
Have you experienced any recent injuries or illnesses that could have affected your ability to feel your head?
Yeah I jumped off a building.

possible_next_steps: Seek immediate medical evaluation due to the recent jump from a building.
Monitor for any signs of head injury, confusion, or loss of consciousness.
Provide a calm environment and reassurance until medical help is available.
summary: The patient, a 7-year-old male, feels he cannot touch or feel his head.
He does not report pain or discomfort when he attempts to touch it.
There are no additional sensations or difficulties noted in other body parts.
The patient has a recent history of jumping off a building, which may indicate potential injury.
